attributes.action: Change the voting rules surrounding new policy introduced after the general election manifesto
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: When a Political Party introduce their manifesto at General Election, the public vote for their preferred party based on that manifesto. The chosen Government can then introduce any new policy during their term, without further public consultation. This should be changed so that every new policy is subject to a referendum, to ensure that the public are given the opportunity to agree or not.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
